question_text: Which of the following best describes why booting from external media is a useful step in system crash diagnostics?
answer_options: It verifies if the CPU is compatible with the installed OS
It helps isolate software and OS-level causes from hardware faults
It improves memory utilization during POST
It forces device driver reinstallation on all hardware
correct_answer: It helps isolate software and OS-level causes from hardware faults
explanation: If the system functions normally when booted from external media, the issue likely lies in the OS or storage device rather than hardware.
